Google Earth Enterprise Search Framework API Reference

Interface Summary
com.google.earth.search.api The main search plugin interface
 

The Search Framework Java API is used to write a plug-in application for Google Earth or Google Maps to search a custom data source. The plug-in creates requests and responses in the framework's Common Search Format, a generic format that can be adapted to deal with spatial data from any data store. For further information, see the Search Framework API Developer Guide.

Class Summary
GeomMetadata A simple data structure for holding per-geometry metadata such as:
name - a label for the geometry snippet - a short piece of text to associate with the geometry description - text (possibly lengthy) to associate with the geometry
KmlPluginPreferences Abstract class for pluging preferences for general purpose KML returned by the various Google Earth Search plugins.
KmlProperties KmlProperties is a container of KML property keys for use within the search framework.
KmlSearchPlugin This abstraction provides Kml style search response using KmlPluginPreferences.
PluginPreferences Abstract class for preferences for the KML returned by the various plugins.
SearchContainer A SearchContainer is the object that stores a single search request issued by any supported interface and stores any number of search responses to this request.
SearchRequest A SearchRequest is the object that encapsulates the parameters from search requests issued by supported interfaces.
SearchResponse A SearchResponse is an object that represents one or many result sets as created by a single search plug-in
StyleData A class for representing styles to associate with each geometry
